FEEDBACK - POSTIVE:
1) I am relieved I have been able to make my application online and at the weekend, as I did not feel able to discuss the matter at work as colleagues would have been listening.

2) The form was simple and straight forward and I was able to navigate it easily.
FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT:
1) I would have liked the form to be available on the access to work website, although I understand this may be a new system you are trialling. 

2) Working for a Government department I understand how the internet is being used more, if customers are happy to use it then there should be an acceptable email policy in each department. 

3) A separate section before Submit to add anything I felt I had forgotten to mention would have been helpful, or the ability to go back to the previous page and add further information if necessary.
1) Give examples of the type of answers you either receive or expect.

FEEDBACK - POSTIVE: 1) It was great, no need to improve it.
1) The service appears to be simple enough to use easily.

FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT: 1) Possibly use fewer close-ended questions e.g., you ask do we know what would help us? Yes or No; but for me I know a little but am wondering if there is anything else.
1) options to have current employer and option to list where and when you are moving to new

FEEDBACK - NEUTRAL: I'd like to see the outcome before I make a comment

FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT:
1) You could add a back button so you could go back and amend/add items you remember along the way. At the moment you can press back on your browser to see the previous page, but when you move forward again, all that you typed before you went back disappears.

2) Some facility to review the completed document before sending would be useful

3) the opportunity to download a copy for your own records.  Since I can't see what I've sent, I'm not sure that I have completed the form to the best of my ability, or that I haven't missed something out.

FEEDBACK - POSTIVE: 1) I can't thinkof any imporvement it was quick and easy to complete
1) If the service delivers what is promised, I am very impressed and it will make a huge difference

FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT: 1) To be able to access this on my surrey work computer as this wasn't avalible to access on my work laptop and I had to send it to my personal iPad.

FEEDBACK - POSTIVE: 1) Very quick and clear ad simple questions.

FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT: 1) I am only at the very beginning of the process so I am unsure how it will work out - when I have contacted Access to Work previously it was by telephone so it was possible to discuss issues in more detail
1) an extra box for additional notes or explaination if needed.
1) mention about personalised online form being available on your .gov websites after initial contact has been made with ATW team

1) Ability to go back and review what you had written. When I tried to do this I had to fill out a section again.

2) Also, would be useful to see or be able to print out the application before and after submitting it so any changes can be made. I copied and pasted each section into a document as I went along when I realised that could not do this.

FEEDBACK - POSTIVE: 1) so far so good.

FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT:
1) Add a remaining time counter and a way to reset the counter whilst filling in the application. I got timed out as I was writing up.

2) It would also be great to be able to download a PDF version of the completed form after submitting.
1) having a Video with BSl relay would be ideal to visual to understand our questions

FEEDBACK - POSTIVE: nothing at all, very easy indeed
1) I was very happy to actually be able to finally complete this application today.
FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT:
1) I sent off my application using this service several weeks ago, only to be told they hadn't received it. I was then told to reapply, when I did, I got all the way to the end of the application and it came up with an error saying I "didn't have access to view this page" which meant I couldn't apply again! I had to then email again to ask for a new link, which has now been successful so far!

2) I know this is a new service, so just making sure things like that don't happen again would improve this service greatly, perhaps sending an email out too, to let applicants know their applications were received properly and being looked into. As with mine, I had no idea they hadn't received it until a week later!

FEEDBACK - POSTIVE: 1) Thank you though for trying to providing financial support.  I think that's great :)
FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT:
1) I first contacted Access to Work in August 2015.  I have tried calling and emailing, and today I've been prompted to complete this online form. I've yet to speak to a real person.

2) I think it is fantastic that the government is trying to provide support for people with dissabilities, but I find the process you have to go through to get it is impersonal and daunting.  

3) I generally don't mind filling out application forms, but somehow this one made me feel very uncomfortable.

4) Also, it would be good if you would provide an option to review answers given before submitting it and also to print and/or save a copy.
1) Websites https encryption certificate is weak and out of date.

FEEDBACK - POSTIVE: It was a fantastic and easy service so I do not think it needs improving.
Very misleading. I asked for a workstation assessment and all I get is an application form for a grant with no explanation or timescale. I still have no idea if I will receive my assessment.
TEST

Because I am autistic I like to know more details about what things will happen. I would prefer to know if/when boss would be called so that I can tell them I've applied, and whether I would be contacted first to make sure that eligible for Access to Work. Also anxious about someone possibly coming to my work and not knowing how that works (meeting at work, who would be present, or would someone follow me around all day). More information before application process would make it better.
BSL version would be handy
At present i am very happy with the sevice i have receied you have been very fast to respond to my emails and taking me through the process.

Not sure but I got half way through the first attempt and the message 'something is wrong' came up.  I cancelled and started from the beginning to do a new application and this time completed.  It may have expired when I was looking for the information I needed.  Perhaps this time allocated needs to be slightly longer.
I got dyslexia and you as me to type so much, com-on. offer me phone contact or call me before get deep.

FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT: I feel that there could be a free text box that deals specifically with any changes to circumstances.

FEEDBACK - POSTIVE: Nothing, very quick and easy

FEEDBACK - IMPROVEMENT: The initial page on the website doesnt appear to have a clear link to the application form? I deal with employees who have to use the service as part of my job in HR and many of them dont even know abotu access to work, and even if they do they dont understand the process - the website isnt very clear if you are unfamiliar witht he process
It seems very straightforward, though I was unable to do anything with the letter for my employer. It would help if this could be emailed from the web page. Other than that all seems very good.

You could have a "go back" button so that I can move across the different parts of the application , - In the end before we hit the "submit" button, you could have a summary of the answers as well -this way we have better visibility before we submit and review everything

FEEDBACK - POSTIVE: No , not really , liked the idea of online application form rather than paper based as quicker to process I presume. Perhaps use drop down menu to choose my certain disability / and my difficulties I would experience with my employment.  But some good progress there

I wanted to ask if my interpreter could start supporting me straight away as I started work last week and hoped this could be back dated rather than waiting another week or so as it limits what I can do.

As a deaf person who is unable to use the telephone, I was originally very pleased for the option to apply for an Access to Work grant using the online digital service. It all appeared to be quite straightforward and I set about getting my application ready. Unfortunately, the link that was sent to me become inactive very quickly, and multiple attempts (two emails and one phone call via Text Relay) at contacting DWP to request a new link were unsuccessful. This meant that my application was unnecessarily delayed and valuable working time was wasted chasing this up. It wasn't until the fourth contact that I was finally supplied with a new link, by which time I was already six weeks into my new job. Once I eventually gained access to the online application system, I found this to be very easy to use and it would have been reasonably straightforward had the link not become inactive so early on. I would suggest that you ensure personal links remain active for at least the six week deadline you give to applicants. Your service could also be improved if advisors responded to enqueries/requests for assistance in a timely and practical manner. The process has taken far longer than it needed to.
It's difficult to say at this point until I hear back about my application.

Allow the user to save to form so they can finish it later instead of having to restart from scratch, also the fact that the form expires so quickly is not good for people who don't want to rush when filling in an important form
I work in a differnt location to my line manager which is again a different address to the 'company' address.  A little more clarity on which address is required may be useful here
I am very happy
The process appears designed for new applicants. It would be much easier if repeat applicants or people seeking a review like myself were branched off the main questions.

There was nothing at the outset to indicate that the process allowed for any accessibility options. No link to options etc. For example the grey contrast on non-selected items is insufficient and confusing. The yellow border around selected items also lacks contrast and is confusing for anyone who is colourblind.

I am surprised to see that, yet again, different font sizes are in use. Different font sizes are for designers and marketers. They have no place in terms of accessibility. The text on the green "Send feedback" button needs to be the same size as the text below this box asking me to not include personal or financial information.
Very good service
seemed to work well - i understand this is a beta version but suffered no glitches

The instructions were straightforward to understand.  The font size used is of a good size.   May need to provide some guidance on completing the free text sections; this may depend on how well users can articulate their needs.
It's difficult to think of anything - I found this easy to use, clear and concise. Excellent website. Thank you
